Package server

Class GameServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.GameServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class GameServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents the game server that accepts clients and matches them up for a game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameServer

        public GameServer​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Checks whether a server port was provided, if it was and it's a valid number, sets that as the port. If however the port provided is an invalid number it sets it to the default 8888 port. If no port is provided the sets the port to 0 which will indicate the setup() that it needs to prompt the user for a port. Also initialises the gameCount (which is basically id of games) to 0 and starts a new TUI.
        Parameters:
        args - May include the server port.

    • Method Detail

      • getServerSocket

        public java.net.ServerSocket getServerSocket()
        Getter for the server socket
        Returns:
        The server socket.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the server on a new thread.
        Parameters:
        args - May include the server port,

      • run

        public void run()
        Server's loop for listening for new client connections. To pair up clients for games it uses a simple approach whereby first client connected waits until someone else connects and then they are paired for a game. Then next client that connects again waits for an opponent and so forth.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setup

        public void setup()
           throws ServerSocketException
        Sets up a server socket on a specific port that is either given by the user or is prompted.
        Throws:
        ServerSocketException
        ExitProgram - if socket can't be created on the specific port.

      • shutdownServer

        public void shutdownServer()
        Closes the server socket
